Net productivity of the population was calculated by summing the production rates (wet g m 2 per frond per day; Tussenbroek, I989a. Growth was measured as the increase in number of nodes on the fronds. Prod = mean daily production for spring and autumn, multiplied by 365

Model based on changes in standing crop and foliar area. By multiplying the NAR by the LAI, the crop growth rate (CGR) can be calculated.he formula for NAP, is: NAR= (in A2 - In Aa) (A2 - Aa) -a (W2 - Wl) (t2 - tl) -1, where A is the calculated mean area per plant (from the mean weight per plant using conversion in Table 1) and W is the calculated mean g carbon or nitrogen per plant (from the mean weight per plant and conversions in Table 2)
